H6135.def: = state in which humans or animals, whether male or female, are unable to procreate

H2342.def: = action by which humans delay action until the right moment, with a certain amount of confidence that this moment will actually come

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H8074.def: = state in which an area has become empty as a result of destruction and depopulation

H1166.def: = action by which someone exercises authority over other people

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H7337.def: = state in which an object is large in size

H4725.def: = a specific area or point in space

H168.def: = construction ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► used as a temporary residence by nomads, soldiers, shepherds, and even as a sanctuary

H5186.def: = state in which a relatively straight object is shaped into a curve

H3407.def: = long strip ◄ of cloth, usually made out of goat's hair or linen, ► sewn together to form larger pieces of cloth used as covering for a tent or for separating one room from another

H4908.def: = location where a family or household lives, or where a deity is said to reside

H2820.def: = causative action by which human or deities keep something to themselves, refusing to give it to someone else

H748.def: = to be long or to increase in length

H4340.def: = relatively thin piece of stout cord; ◄ made by twisting together palm fibers, linen, or reeds; ► especially used as tent cord or bowstring

H3489.def: = small, pointed object ► driven into a wall or the ground and used for hanging things on or securing something in place; ≈ associated with firmness and security

H2388.def: = state in which humans or deities are strong in a physical, political, or military sense, or simply in their ability to convince others with words

H6555.def: = process by which a container bursts open due to abundance of contents

H3225.def: = the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun

H8040.def: = the side of the human body which is to the north when facing the direction of the rising sun; in extension: one option as opposed to another

H2233.def: = a flowering plant’s unit of reproduction, capable of developing into another such plant, in some cases also used as food

H3423.def: = process by which humans gain ownership of land and other possessions, which often implies that these possessions will be passed on to the next generation

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H8074.def: = state in which an area has become empty as a result of destruction and depopulation

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H3372.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H954.def: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status

H3637.def: = state in which humans experience a feeling of shame, as a result of their own actions or because of what other have done

H2659.def: = action by which animals strike the ground with their feet

H1322.def: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status

H5934.def: = state in which humans are still relatively young; ≈ associated with strength but also with reckless living

H2781.def: = state in which humans feel shame and humiliation, ◄ due to one's own shortcomings or misfortune and/or contempt from other people

H491.def: = state in which women have lost their husband, ► which requires them to wear widow's clothing; ≈ associated with disgrace

H1166.def: = action by which someone exercises authority over other people

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6635.def: = state of being in the service of the community; ≈ sometimes associated with suffering and heavy labor

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H6918.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H802.def: = woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not

H5800.def: = action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H3988.def: = state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H7281.def: = a very short length of time

H5800.def: = action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place

H7356.def: = state in which humans feel compassion for others, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well-being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action

H6908.def: = action by which humans or animals come together as a group for a common purpose

H7110.def: = process by which humans or deities respond with anger to a situation in which (other) humans have disobeyed an order or broken a law

H5641.def: = state in which people or objects are in a location where they cannot be readily seen or where danger cannot reach them

H7281.def: = a very short length of time

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H7355.def: = state in which humans feel affection for others

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H5146.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Lamech<SDBH:לֶמֶךְ>}; descendant of {L:Seth<SDBH:שֵׁת>}; ► father of {L:Shem<SDBH:שֵׁם>}, {L:Ham<SDBH:חָם>}, {L:Japheth<SDBH:יֶפֶת>}

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H7650.def: = action by which humans or deities make a solemn statement often calling on a higher power to confirm that what is said is true or to punish the speaker if it turns out not to be true

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H7107.def: = process by which humans in a position of authority or deities respond with anger to a situation in which (other) humans have disobeyed an order or broken a law

H1605.def: = action by which humans or deities speak to animals, humans, deities, or natural objects in anger, in order to express their displeasure and cause them to change their behavior

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H4185.def: = process why which an object gets detached from the place where it has been fixed

H1389.def: = an elevation of the earth’s surface rising gradually and to a relatively small height from the surrounding level; generally lower than a {L:mountain<SDBH:הַר>}

H4131.def: = state in which an object is not firmly fixed to the surface on which it stands so that it can move or slip; to waver

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H1285.def: = a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H7355.def: = state in which humans feel affection for others

H6041.def: = a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility

H5162.def: = causative action by which humans or deities seek to make (other) humans feel relief after a time of grief, anxiety, or fear

H595.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H7257.def: = action by which humans or animals assume a horizontal position, either to rest or to attack

H68.def: = hard, heavy, and strong substance, ◄ very commonly found in nature,  ► which can be hewn into different shapes by a craftsman

H6320.def: = a black powder, ► used as eye make-up

H3245.def: = causative action by which humans put in place the bottom part of a building or larger structure, usually below the ground level, which will have to bear the entire construction

H5601.def: = (semi-)precious stone with a deep blue color, possibly sapphire

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H8121.def: = celestial body ► that marks day and night and produces warmth and light for the earth

H3539.def: exact meaning unsure; possibly: = precious stone with a bright red color

H688.def: exact meaning unsure: = precious stone, probably with a fiery glow

H68.def: = hard, heavy, and strong substance, ◄ very commonly found in nature,  ► which can be hewn into different shapes by a craftsman

H1366.def: = a set of limits that separates part of a whole from other parts, with focus either on the limits itself or on the area or object surrounded by it

H2656.def: = state in which humans and deities are emotionally attached to (other) humans

H3928.def: = state in which animals have adapted themselves to the conditions of a certain environment

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H6666.def: = something that one considers one's rightful due

H3559.def: = state in which an object is firmly and immovably located in a certain place

H7368.def: = state in which humans or objects are located in a place that is at a relatively great distance from the point of reference

H3372.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H4288.def: = state in which objects are being broken or destroyed; ≈ often used figuratively to denote difficult circumstances

H7126.def: = action by which humans or animals move to a location relatively close to the location in focus

H1481.def: = state in which humans live in a place that is not their place of origin or nationality, either permanently or for a substantial period of time

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H5307.def: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

H595.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H1254.def: = causative action by which humans cause something else to get its desired shape by cutting off certain parts of it

H2796.def: = person with the skill to produce an artifact out of rough materials, such as stone, wood, metal

H5301.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause air to flow from their nose or mouth upon an object

H6352.def: = a lightweight black carbon material, ◄ made by heating wood in an environment devoid of air, ► and used as fuel

H784.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H3627.def: = human-made object of any kind, usually specified by the context, ◄ of various makings ► and made for various purposes

H4639.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H7843.def: = process by which objects are affected by violence, destruction, putrefaction, pollution, blemishes, and other factors that may have a destructive impact

H3627.def: = human-made object of any kind, usually specified by the context, ◄ of various makings ► and made for various purposes

H6743.def: = action by which an outside force (perhaps divine) quickly comes over a person, gaining control over the person or causing some immediate outcome

H7561.def: = state in which humans are or are considered to be in a state of guilt before God or humans, ◄ as a result of (allegedly) having acted in a way that is contrary to the law

H3956.def: = the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H5159.def: = process by which possessions are transferred from one generation to the next

H5650.def: = man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6666.def: = something that one considers one's rightful due

H5002.def: = action by which humans or deities make a prophetic statement; in the case of a deity this is usually done through the mouth of a prophet or seer
